title: Can you solve the prisoner hat riddle? - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What is the task given to the captives by the alien overlords?

options.label: A
options.text: Guess the color of the hat on the alien's head.

options.label: B
options.text: Guess the color of their own hat.

options.label: C
options.text: Count the number of black hats in front of them.

options.label: D
options.text: Determine the total number of captives.

multiple-choice.question: What is the condition for the captives to be spared?

options.label: D
options.text: None of the captives guess correctly.

multiple-choice.question: What information does the person at the back of the line use to communicate to the others?

options.label: A
options.text: The total number of black hats.

options.label: B
options.text: The parity of the number of black hats (odd or even).

options.label: C
options.text: The color of their own hat.

multiple-choice.question: What is the strategy agreed upon by the captives for guessing their hat colors?

options.label: A
options.text: The first person says "black" if they see an even number of black hats and "white" if they see an odd number.

options.label: B
options.text: The first person says "black" if they see an odd number of black hats and "white" if they see an even number.

options.label: C
options.text: The first person says "black" if they see a black hat and "white" if they see a white hat.

options.label: D
options.text: The first person says "black" if they see a white hat and "white" if they see a black hat.

multiple-choice.question: How does the person in the middle of the line use the information given by the person at the back of the line to guess their hat color?

options.label: A
options.text: They count the number of black hats in front of them and compare it to the number given by the person at the back of the line.

options.label: B
options.text: They look for an even number of black hats in front of them and deduce that their hat is white.

options.label: C
options.text: They look for an odd number of black hats in front of them and deduce that their hat is black.

options.label: D
options.text: They do not use the information given by the person at the back of the line to guess their hat color.

multiple-choice.question: What happens when the person at the front of the line sees an odd number of black hats?

options.label: A
options.text: They deduce that their hat is white.

options.label: B
options.text: They deduce that their hat is black.

options.label: C
options.text: They are unsure of their hat color.

options.label: D
options.text: They are eaten by the alien overlords.

multiple-choice.question: What is the key to the strategy used by the captives to guess their hat colors?

options.label: A
options.text: The first person's guess is always correct.

options.label: B
options.text: The first person has a 50% chance of giving a wrong answer about their own hat.

options.label: C
options.text: The first person's guess determines the color of all the other hats.

options.label: D
options.text: The first person's guess is not important to the strategy.

multiple-choice.question: How does the strategy used by the captives work for any possible arrangement of the hats?

options.label: A
options.text: The first person's guess is always correct.

options.label: B
options.text: The first person has a 50% chance of giving a wrong answer about their own hat, but the parity information they convey allows everyone else to guess theirs with absolute certainty.

options.label: C
options.text: The first person's guess determines the color of all the other hats.

options.label: D
options.text: The first person's guess is not important to the strategy.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the strategy used by the captives?

options.label: A
options.text: They are all eaten by the alien overlords.

options.label: B
options.text: They are all spared because at least 9 captives guess correctly.

options.label: C
options.text: They are all spared because the first person's guess is always correct.

options.label: D
options.text: They are all spared because the first person's guess determines the color of all the other hats.

multiple-choice.question: What is the implication of the strategy used by the captives for the alien overlords?

options.label: A
options.text: They will have to eat the captives.

options.label: B
options.text: They will have to find less logical organisms to abduct.

options.label: C
options.text: They will have to change their rules.

options.label: D
options.text: They will have to go hungry.

title: What "Orwellian" really means - Noah Tavlin

multiple-choice.question: Who was the British author that the term "Orwellian" was named after?

options.label: D

title: How false news can spread - Noah Tavlin

multiple-choice.question: Who is usually attributed to saying the quote "A lie can travel halfway around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes"?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: They may contract contagious diseases that are not contagious

options.label: D
options.text: They may not contract contagious diseases

options.label: B
options.text: The article can be referenced in serious science publications

options.label: D
options.text: The article can be removed from publication

options.label: C
options.text: Tracing the original source of a report

options.text: More people have contracted contagious diseases that are not contagious

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: The truth can travel faster than a lie

options.label: B
options.text: A lie can travel faster than the truth

options.label: C
options.text: A lie can be easily debunked

options.label: D
options.text: The truth can be easily debunked
